name: Cucumber and Radish Raita
description: This can be spicy or not, depending on what you are serving it with and your taste for heat. Cucumber raita (without the radishes) is a classic accompaniment to curries, but I like it on its own and spooned over grains. It’s also very nice with salmon.
recipeCategory: easy, quick, condiments, salads and dressings
keywords: cucumber, radish, yogurt, gluten-free, healthy, low cholesterol, low-fat, low-sodium, nut-free, vegetarian, summer
recipeIngredient: 3/4 pound cucumber (1 European or 4 Persian), peeled if waxed, seeded if necessary, and finely diced or shredded
1 teaspoon cumin seeds, lightly toasted and ground
1/2 teaspoon coriander seeds, lightly toasted and ground
2 to 3 tablespoons finely chopped cilantro, to taste
1 to 2 serrano or bird chilies, finely chopped (optional)

recipeInstructions.text: Combine all the ingredients. Taste and adjust salt and other seasonings. Refrigerate until ready to serve.
